page.title: 02A brief history of Elton
page.content: Elton, or "Athelniton" as it was known in Norman times was originally a Saxon village, before being taken over by a Danish Lord of the Manor after the invasions of the ninth and tenth centuries.In 1025 it passed to the Bishop of Dorchester after a wager with the Lord of the Manor and eventually the Crown.The Manor was bought about 1602 by the Proby family, who still live at Elton Hall. The population has been fairly stable, but with declining numbers in this century: 664 in 1792, 738 in 1831 and 560 in 1984.However,the beginnings of new expansion are apparent in the building of a new estate on the north west side of the village.A recent survey by pupils from Elton school found that there were 52 houses built before 1800, 32 between 1800 and 1945 and 128 since then.
